title: North Korea: U.S. Will Pay a Price if Tougher Sanctions Are Imposed
summary: North Korea threatened to inflict the “greatest pain and suffering” on the U.S. if the U.N. imposes fresh sanctions against the country over its latest nuclear test, as South Korea backed calls to squeeze oil imports.

title: Storm Wreaks Havoc on Florida’s Grid, Leaving Millions Without Power—Energy Journal
summary: Hurricane Irma Wreaks Havoc on Florida's Grid, Leaving Millions Without Power

title: WSJ’s Daily Shot: Retail Investors More Optimistic Than at Any Time Since the Dot-Com Bubble
Investors Bet on Thailand, Even as Country Faces Uncertainty
summary: Investors don’t like political uncertainty. But the fact that Thailand’s former prime minister recently absconded before potentially getting a 10-year prison sentence may have been a good thing for the country’s markets.

title: Oil Prices Rebound Some as Risk Sentiment Improves
summary: Oil futures rose in Asia, recovering some after Friday’s slide, amid a start-of-week move by investors out of risk assets and back into commodities and equities.

title: Saudis Stress Commitment to Economic Change Despite Challenges
summary: it acknowledged that some changes may not happen as fast as it had hoped.
